{{Infobox person | honorific_prefix = | name = Troy Parfitt | honorific_suffix = | image = | image_size = | caption = Troy Parfitt | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1972|01|07}} | birth_place = | death_date = | residence = [[New Brunswick, Canada]] | nationality = [[Canada|Canadian]] | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = [[University of New Brunswick|U. New Brunswick]] | alma_mater = | occupation = | years_active = Travel writer,
English teacher | employer = | organization = | known_for = | notable_works = ''Notes from the Other China'' | style = | influences = | influenced = | home_town = | party = | movement = | religion = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = Foster Parfitt | relatives = | awards = | signature = | website = }} '''Troy Parfitt''' is a [[Canada|Canadian]]{{cite news |title= PARFITT, FOSTER |publisher= ''Telegraph-Journal'' |quote= Foster is survived by one son Troy Parfitt ... |date= August 4, 2009 |url= http://telegraphjournal.canadaeast.com/classifieds/obituaries/listing.php?id=230811&t=0&c=8&pub=2&period= |accessdate= 2011-04-27 }}{{cite news |author= Craig Ferguson |title= Notes From The Other China – book launch |publisher= ''craig ferguson images (newsletter)'' |year= 2006 |url= http://www.craigfergusonimages.com/2007/12/notes-from-the-other-china-book-launch/ |accessdate= 2011-04-27 }} [[author]] and traveler who focuses on critical travel commentary and cultural exposes. He grew up in [[New Brunswick, Canada]] but has lived in [[Taipei, Taiwan|Taiwan]] and [[Korea]] and has taught [[English language|English]] as a second language in East Asia for twelve years. He wrote two books, called ''Notes From The Other China'' and ''Why China Will Never Rule the World''. As well as this he also taught History for a year in Scotland. ==Reviews== Reviewer Bradley Winterton in the ''Taipei Times'', reviewing his first book, described Parfitt as a "bad traveler, an insensitive loud-mouth ranting on about the absurdities of life ''abroad''".{{cite news |author= Bradley Winterton (book reviewer) Troy Parfitt (author) |title= 'Notes From the Other China' stirs emotions |publisher= ''Taipei Times'' |quote= ''Notes from the Other China'' is the memoir of a Canadian, Troy Parfitt, ... |date= Jan 20, 2008 |url= http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/feat/archives/2008/01/20/2003398111 |accessdate= 2011-04-27 }} Reviewer John Burroughs described it as "travel commentary and cultural analysis."{{cite news |author= John Burroughs |title= Reviewer's Bookwatch |publisher= ''Midwest Book Review'' |quote= Volume 8, Number 2 -- Troy combines memoir with travel commentary and cultural analysis w... |date= February 2008 |url= http://www.midwestbookreview.com/rbw/feb_08.htm |accessdate= 2011-04-27 }} Reviewer Alan Caruba in the ''Canada Free Press'' described Parfitt as his "own man" with an "eye for detail and a talent for describing his journey in ways that do not ignore some obvious and ugly truths about the real China."{{cite news |author= Alan Caruba (reviewer) |title= China is NOT the Future (op-ed piece) |publisher= ''Canada Free Press'' |quote= Parfitt is his own man... |date= March 21, 2011 |url= http://www.canadafreepress.com/index.php/article/34674 |accessdate= 2011-04-27 }} Reviewer Terence P. Ward of ''AllBooks Review'' wrote that Parfitt is "fluent in Mandarin" and "brings a lot of information to the table" to back up his claims about China being filthy, overcrowded, with unimaginable poverty, and "pollution so thick that it obscures the sun".{{cite news |author= Terence P Ward |title= (book title:) Why China Will Never Rule the World |publisher= ''AllBooks Review'' |date= April 2011 |url= http://www.allbooksreviewint.com/ReviewShowcase.html |accessdate= 2011-04-28 }} According to Ward, Parfitt argues that "China is romanticized, and cannot possibly ever rule the world because its population is willfully ignorant, poorly educated, and clueless about the world beyond that nation's borders." ''Vancouver Sun'' reviewer Jonathan Manthorpe agreed with Parfitt's conclusion that "China is unlikely to be an influential [[superpower]] because its current regime has no vision, its economy has developed no capacity for innovation, and there is no sense of optimism" as well as Parfitt's assessment that "China is a gloomy, bitter, [[xenophobic]] and ill-favoured place."{{cite news |author= Jonathan Manthorpe (reviewer) |title= Thesis that China lacks superpower qualities is sound |publisher= ''Vancouver Sun'' |date= May 2, 2011 |url= https://vancouversun.com/Thesis+that+China+lacks+superpower+qualities+sound/4708471/story.html |accessdate= 2011-05-04 }} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Parfitt, Troy}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Writers from New Brunswick]] [[Category:Canadian travel writers]] [[Category:Cultural critics]] [[Category:Writers about China]] [[Category:1972 births]]

{{Eastern Slavic name|Dmitrievitch|Bolotov}} {{Infobox officeholder |name = Valery Bolotov |nationality = |image = Valeri Bolotov.png |imagesize = |caption = Valery Bolotov in 2014. |office = [[Luhansk People's Republic|People's Governor of the Luhansk People's Republic]] |term_start = 18 May 2014 |term_end = 14 August 2014 |deputy = [[Sergey Tsyplakov]] |primeminister= [[Vasily Nikitine]]
[[Marat Bashirov]] {{small|(Acting)}} |predecessor = [[Gennadiy Tsypkalov]] {{small|(Acting)}} |successor = [[Igor Plotnitsky]] {{small|(as Head of state)}} |term_start2 = |term_end2 = |predecessor2 = |constituency2= |alma_mater = |birth_date = {{Birth date|1970|02|13|}} |birth_place = [[Stakhanov, Ukraine|Stakhanov]], [[Luhansk Oblast|Voroshilovgrad Oblast]], [[Ukrainian SSR]]
or [[Taganrog]], [[Rostov oblast]], [[Russian SFSR]], [[USSR]] |death_date ={{Death date and age|2017|1|27|1970|02|13|df=yes}} |death_place = [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] |party = |religion = |signature = Signature of Valeryi Bolotov.jpg | website = |allegiance = {{flag|Soviet Union}}
{{flag|Luhansk People's Republic}} |branch = [[File:USSR Airborne troops emblem1 1991.jpg|20px]] Airborne Troops |serviceyears = 1988–90
2014–17 |rank = [[File:Rank_insignia_of_%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B0%D1%80%D1%88%D0%B8%D0%B9_%D1%81%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B6%D0%B0%D0%BD%D1%82_of_the_Soviet_Air_Force.svg|12px]] Senior sergeant (see [[staff sergeant]]) |}} '''Valery Dmitrievitch Bolotov''' ({{lang-rus|Вале́рий Дми́триевич Бо́лотов|p=vɐˈlʲerʲɪj ˈdmʲitrʲɪjɪvʲɪtɕ ˈbolətəf}}, {{lang-uk|Вале́рій Дми́трович Бо́лотов}}; 13 February 1970 – 27 January 2017{{cite web|url=http://www.rbc.ru/politics/27/01/2017/588b600e9a79476e71db84f8|title=Умер первый глава ЛНР Валерий Болотов|author=|date=|website=РБК|accessdate=16 April 2018}}) was a [[Russia]]n militant leader known for his involvement in the [[Donbass War]] in [[eastern Ukraine]], and as the leader of the unrecognized [[Luhansk People's Republic]]. ==Biography== The biography of Bolotov before the 2014 is very scarce. There is a video which shows that Bolotov participated in voting at a local referendum and showed a Ukrainian passport which indicated that he was born in [[Taganrog]], [[Rostov Oblast]] on 13 February 1970.{{YouTube|awv0rQpKwc8}} According to other sources, Bolotov was born in Stakhanov.Dergchov, V. ''[https://web.archive.org/web/20170129144230/http://www.rbc.ru/politics/27/01/2017/588b600e9a79476e71db84f8 There died the first leader of LPR (Умер первый глава ЛНР Валерий Болотов)]''. [[RBC Information Systems|RBC]]. 27 January 2017 Bolotov moved to [[Stakhanov, Ukraine|Stakhanov]] in the [[Luhansk Oblast]] (province) of eastern Ukraine in 1974.{{cite news|url=http://www.interfax.com/newsinf.asp?id=505915|title=Top officials appointed in Luhansk people's republic|agency=[[Interfax-Ukraine]]|date=May 19, 2014|accessdate=July 7, 2014}} According to the [[Russia Today]], he held two university degrees.{{cite news|url=http://rt.com/news/159840-lugansk-elects-head-constitution/|title=Self-proclaimed Lugansk People's Republic elects head, passes constitution|date=May 19, 2014|accessdate=July 7, 2014}} Bolotov claimed to be a senior sergeant of the [[Soviet Airborne Troops]] in [[Vitebsk]] (presumably the [[103rd Guards Airborne Division]]){{efn|group=1|During the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan (also known as the [[Soviet war in Afghanistan]]) and until [[fall of the Soviet Union]], the division was under direct jurisdiction of the Soviet [[KGB]]}} and between 1989 and 1990 participated in a number of conflicts including Tbilisi,{{efn|group=1|[[April 9 tragedy]]}} Yerevan and [[Karabakh]].{{efn|group=1|[[Nagorno-Karabakh War]]}}{{cite news|url=http://www.kp.by/daily/26224.3/3106364/|script-title=ru:Кто они, "народные губернаторы": Харьков возглавил автослесарь, а Луганск – десантник|trans-title=Who are those, "People's Governors"? Kharkov- a mechanic, while Lugansk - a paratrooper|work=Komsomolskaya Pravda|language=Russian|date=April 23, 2014|accessdate=May 26, 2014}} He later became the head of the airborne veterans group, while no one of the Luhansk Oblast group cell can confirm it. Bolotov had a wife and two children. Bolotov worked as a manager and director at a meat factory and used to run a small business. Before the pro-Russian unrest in Ukraine, Bolotov was a representative of [[Oleksandr Yefremov]] who supervised illegal mining in the region.{{cite web|url=http://gordonua.com/publications/Petrulevich-Terroristicheskie-gruppy-GRU-Rossii-uzhe-v-Kieve-i-zhdut-signala-29825.html|title=Former chief of Luhansk SBU Petrulevych: The terrorists groups of Russian GRU is already in Kiev and anticipating a signal|publisher=Gordon|date=July 2, 2014|archivedate=October 14, 2014|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141014001733/http://gordonua.com/publications/Petrulevich-Terroristicheskie-gruppy-GRU-Rossii-uzhe-v-Kieve-i-zhdut-signala-29825.html|access-date=October 14, 2014|dead-url=no|df=mdy-all}} In 2014, Bolotov became a leader of an armed group during the [[2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine]]. On May 13, 2014, Bolotov survived an assassination attempt as assailants fired automatic weapons towards his car, wounding the militant leader.{{cite news|url=http://mashable.com/2014/05/13/ukraine-luhansk-assassination-valery-bolotov/|title=Pro-Russian Separatist Leader Survives Assassination Attempt in Ukraine|publisher=Mashable.com|date=May 13, 2014|accessdate=May 13, 2014}} Bolotov was then briefly captured by the [[Armed Forces of Ukraine|Ukrainian army]] on May 17 after he attempted to re-enter [[Luhansk]] following his having received treatment for his injury at a hospital in Russia.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/05/17/us-ukraine-crisis-idUSBREA4G02F20140517|title=Separatists recapture their leader on the eve of peace talks in Ukraine|agency=[[Reuters]]|date=May 17, 2014|accessdate=May 26, 2014}} However, armed supporters of the Luhansk People's Republic attacked the Ukrainian army checkpoint where Bolotov was being held shortly afterwards and successfully freed the "People's Governor". [[Luhansk People's Republic]]'s Parliament elected Bolotov head of the republic on 18 May 2014. Bolotov resigned on 14 August 2014.{{cite news|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2014/08/14/world/europe/ukraine-crisis/|title=Ukraine fighting: Rebel official resigns; shells fall on Donetsk|agency=[[CNN]]|date=August 14, 2014|accessdate=August 14, 2014}} === Death === Bolotov was found dead on 27 January 2017 in his own home in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]]. The causes of his death are currently being investigated. The preliminary results of clinical tests showed an [[acute heart failure]] as reason of death.[http://www.mk.ru/incident/2017/01/27/telo-byvshego-glavy-lnr-valeriya-bolotova-obnaruzhila-ego-supruga.html]{{Cite web|url=https://lenta.ru/news/2017/01/27/bolotov|title=Умер первый глава ЛНР|date=2017-01-27|publisher=[[Lenta.ru]]|accessdate=2017-01-27}}[https://ria.ru/world/20170127/1486662842.html Умер первый глава ЛНР Валерий Болотов]{{Cite web|url=http://www.rbc.ru/rbcfreenews/588c91bb9a7947556f854664?from=newsfeed|title=СМИ узнали причину смерти первого главы ЛНР Валерия Болотова|date=2017-01-28|publisher=[[Росбизнесконсалтинг]]|accessdate=2017-01-28}}[https://ria.ru/world/20170127/1486662842.html Умер первый глава ЛНР Валерий Болотов] The [[poisoning]] later was suspected.{{cite web|url=http://ukropnews24.com/bolotovs-wife-suspects-that-her-husband-was-poisoned/|title=Bolotov’s wife suspects that her husband was poisoned|author=|date=31 January 2017|website=ukropnews24.com|accessdate=16 April 2018}}. Though more detailed report of the local police office claimed that there was no obvious signs of the acute heart failure and only a small [[Atherosclerosis|atherosclerotic]] plaques was identified instead.[https://life.ru/t/%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8/966889/sudmiedekspierty_provieriaiut_krov_bolotova_na_nalichiie_iadov Судмедэксперты проверяют кровь Болотова на наличие ядов] It is known that before death he was complaining to his wife about his health deterioration which happened right after drinking a cup of coffee on the business meeting in company with two men he allegedly knew.[https://life.ru/t/%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8/966853/zhiena_piervogho_ghlavy_lnr_bolotova_podozrievaiet_chto_iegho_otravili_chashkoi_kofie Жена первого главы ЛНР Болотова подозревает, что его отравили чашкой кофе]. It became later known that Bolotov met with ex-speaker of the People's council of the LNR Alexey Karyakin and Valery Alexadnrovich as Valery had said and added also that the meeting was appointed by request of Bolotov himselfhttp://graniru.org/Politics/World/Europe/Ukraine/m.258470.html. Bolotov's corpse was later tested for the presence of the poisoning drugs in his body at the request of his wife, but as of 2018 the results are unknown.[https://life.ru/t/%D0%BD%D0%BE%D0%B2%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8/966889/sudmiedekspierty_provieriaiut_krov_bolotova_na_nalichiie_iadov Судмедэксперты проверяют кровь Болотова на наличие ядов] ==See also== * [[Aleksandr Kharitonov (politician)]] ==Notes== {{Notelist}} ==References== {{commons category|Valery Bolotov}} {{2014 pro-Russian conflict in Ukraine}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bolotov, Valery}} [[Category:1970 births]] [[Category:2017 deaths]] [[Category:People from Taganrog]] [[Category:Russian expatriates in Ukraine]] [[Category:Pro-Russian people of the 2014 pro-Russian unrest in Ukraine]] [[Category:Military personnel of the Nagorno-Karabakh War]] [[Category:Russian nationalists]] [[Category:People of the Luhansk People's Republic]] [[Category:Warlords]] [[Category:People of the Federal Security Service]] [[Category:People of the KGB]] [[Category:Pro-Russian people of the war in Donbass]] [[Category:People of Antimaidan]] [[Category:Independence activists]]

'''Željko Topić''' (born 5 August 1959<ref name="cv-wipo">{{cite web |url=http://www.wipo.int/meetings/en/2009/sym_ip_auth/bios/z_topic.html |title=ŽELJKO TOPIĆ, Director general State Intellectual Property Office of the RC |date=2009 |access-date=2017-12-29 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090910032045/http://www.wipo.int/meetings/en/2009/sym_ip_auth/bios/z_topic.html |publisher=World Intellectual Property Organisation (WIPO) |archive-date=2009-09-10 |dead-url=yes}}</ref>) is a Croatian civil servant, and currently one of the Vice-Presidents of the [[European Patent Office]] (EPO). Before taking up his position at the EPO, he was the Director General of the [[State Intellectual Property Office (Croatia)|State Intellectual Property Office of the Republic of Croatia]].
==Career== He started his career as an economist with the Federal Yugoslavian Railways in [[Banja Luka]]. From 1989 to 1992 he was an adviser at the Croatian Ministry of Science & Technology in Zagreb. In 1992, he joined the Croatian State Intellectual Property Office which came under the remit of the Ministry of Science & Technology and he held various posts there until 2003 when he left to become a partner in a private-sector intellectual property management company, Korper, Haramija & Topić Ltd.<ref name="cv-wipo"/>
In 2004, he was appointed as Director General of the Croatian State Intellectual Property Office for a four-year term.<ref>[http://narodne-novine.nn.hr/clanci/sluzbeni/2004_05_59_1329.html Decision signed by Prime Minister Ivo Sanader appointing Zeljko Topić as Director General of the DZIV], dated 5 May 2004.</ref> In this capacity he represented Croatia on the [[Administrative Council of the European Patent Organisation]] from 2004 onward. Croatia became a full member of the EPO in 2008.<ref>[http://www.epo.org/about-us/organisation/member-states/date.html List of EPC Contracting States sorted according to the date of accession]</ref> In 2006, Topić was proposed as a candidate for a senior management position at the [[World Intellectual Property Organization]] (WIPO).<ref>[http://www.ip-watch.org/2006/05/03/croatia-advances-candidate-for-a-top-position-at-wipo/ "Croatia Advances Candidate For A Top Position At WIPO"], Intellectual Property Watch, 3 May 2006.</ref> His candidacy was unsuccessful.
In March 2008, his mandate as Director General of the Croatian State Intellectual Property Office was renewed for a second four-year term.<ref>[http://narodne-novine.nn.hr/clanci/sluzbeni/2008_03_35_1149.html Decision signed by Prime Minister Ivo Sanader renewing Topić's mandate for a second term], dated 19 March 2008.</ref> In 2009, he was once again an unsuccessful candidate for a senior management position at the WIPO.<ref>[http://www.ip-watch.org/2009/05/05/wipo-buzzing-with-possible-names-for-top-cabinet-posts/ "WIPO Buzzing With Possible Names For Top Cabinet Posts"], Intellectual Property Watch, 5 May 2009.</ref>
In January 2012, his mandate as Director General of the Croatian State Intellectual Property Office was renewed for a third term.<ref>[http://narodne-novine.nn.hr/clanci/sluzbeni/2012_02_16_452.html Decision signed by Prime Minister Zoran Milanović renewing Topić's mandate for a third term], dated 26 January 2012.</ref>
During a visit by a delegation from the Hungarian Intellectual Property Office to the Croatian State Intellectual Property Office in February 2012,<ref>[https://www.dziv.hr/hr/novosti/posjet-delegacije-madarskog-ureda-za-intelektualno-vlasnistvo-zavodu,81.html Posjet delegacije Mađarskog ureda za intelektualno vlasništvo Zavodu]</ref> he was presented with the Jedlik Ányos Award (Honoris Causa)<ref>[http://www.szellemitulajdon.hu/cikkek/kituntek/%C5%BEeljko-topi%C4%87-/205/%C5%BEeljko-topi%C4%87--%E2%80%93-honoris-causa-jedlik-anyos-dijas,-2012.html Željko Topić – Honoris causa Jedlik Ányos-díjas, 2012]</ref><ref>Hungarian Intellectual Property Office: [http://www.sztnh.gov.hu/English/hivatalrol/MSZH_dijak/Jedlik_dij/Jedlik-rendelet.html The Jedlik Ányos Award]</ref> in recognition of his contribution to the protection of intellectual property.
In March 2012, the Administrative Council of the EPO announced his appointment as Vice-President at the EPO in charge of the Directorate-General Administration which has responsibility for support services such as Human Resources, General Administration, Buildings and Facility Management, and the Language Service.<ref>[http://www.epo.org/news-issues/news/2012/20120328.html Announcement by the Administrative Council of the EPO], dated 28 March 2012.</ref> He commenced his duties as EPO Vice-President in April 2012.<ref>[http://blog.epo.org/the-epo/towards-a-more-diverse-epo/ Towards a more diverse EPO], EPO Blog dated 2 April 2012.</ref> His term of office as Director General of the Croatian State Intellectual Property Office ended on 30 April 2012.<ref>[http://narodne-novine.nn.hr/clanci/sluzbeni/2012_05_53_1328.html Decision signed by Prime Minister Zoran Milanović confirming the termination of Topić's term of office effective as from 30 April 2012], dated 27 April 2012.</ref>
Topić's appointment as EPO Vice-President has been controversial. Following the announcement of his appointment in March 2012, a number of critical news reports appeared in the Croatian media. These reports referred to a series of alleged irregularities which were said to have occurred during his period of office as Director-General of the State Intellectual Property Office and which it was claimed had not been properly investigated by the competent state authorities.<ref>[http://www.index.hr/vijesti/clanak/nagradio-ga-pantovcak-umjesto-progona-ravnatelj-zavoda-koji-nadzire-zamp-promoviran/608936.aspx "Nagradio ga Pantovčak: Umjesto progona, ravnatelj Zavoda koji nadzire ZAMP promoviran!"] index.hr, 10 April 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.tjedno.hr/index.php/categoryblog/998-protiv-topia-se-vodi-estpostupaka "Protiv Topića se vodi šest postupaka"] tjedno.hr, 11 April 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.index.hr/vijesti/clanak/index-doznaje--jovanovic-istrazuje-dziv-gdje-je-milijun-kuna-tko-se-vozio-u-preskupim-automobilima/611883.aspx "Index doznaje – Jovanović istražuje DZIV: Gdje je milijun kuna, tko se vozio u (pre)skupim automobilima?"] index.hr, 26 April 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.jutarnji.hr/kazneni-progon-nije-ga-zaustavio--sanaderov-kadar-zeljko-topic--smijenjen-na-vlastiti-zahtjev--dobio-jos-bolji-posao/1024680/ "Sanaderov kadar Željko Topić, smijenjen na vlastiti zahtjev, dobio još bolji posao"] jutarnji.hr, 28 April 2012</ref> In response, the State Intellectual Property Office issued a press release on 30 April 2012 attributing the media reports to what it called "unprofessional journalism" and dismissing the allegations raised against Topić as "arbitrary", "unfounded" and based on "malicious accusations".<ref>[http://www.dziv.hr/files/File/novosti/Priopcenje_za_javnost_30042012.pdf “PRIOPCENJE ZA JAVNOST”], press release issued by the Croatian State Intellectual Property Office, 30 April 2012</ref>
A complaint which Topić filed in reaction to an article written by the journalist Slavica Lukić for "Jutarnji list" was, however, rejected by the Ethics Council of the Croatian Journalist's Association (Croatian: ''Hrvatsko Novinarsko Društvo'' or HND) in September 2012. The Ethics Council found that Lukić had verified the relevant information with the appropriate official institutions and that the disputed article was not written with the intention of defaming anyone but rather in defence of the public interest.<ref>[http://www.hnd.hr/hr/Zakljucci7sjednice2012/show/66192/ "Findings of the 7th Session of the HND Ethics Council held on 18 September 2012 - Željko Topić vs Slavica Lukić"], Hrvatsko Novinarsko Društvo, 16 November 2012</ref><ref>[http://www.dnevno.hr/vijesti/hrvatska/85582-bivsi-ravnatelj-dziv-a-zeljko-topic-zakinuo-je-hrvatske-knjizevnike-za-milijune-kuna.html “Bivši ravnatelj DZIV-a Željko Topić zakinuo je hrvatske književnike za milijune kuna”], dnevno.hr, 28 April 2013</ref>
In December 2013, a Croatian NGO Juris Protecta raised questions about Topić's EPO appointment and submitted a petition to the [[European Parliament]] calling for an independent investigation into the matter.<ref>[http://www.ip-watch.org/2014/05/15/epo-internal-strife-spills-over-into-european-parliament-human-rights-court/ “EPO Internal Strife Spills Over Into European Parliament, Human Rights Court”], Intellectual Property Watch, 15 May 2014</ref><ref>[https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/dontsleep/btEDPh6u7o0 Press release issued by Juris Protecta]</ref> According to [[Intellectual Property Watch]], Topić and EPO President [[Benoît Battistelli]] claim that the allegations amount to a “smear campaign.” However, a former Assistant Director at the Croatian State Intellectual Property Office, Vesna Stilin, has disputed the claims made by Topić and Battistelli in this regard.<ref>[http://www.index.hr/vijesti/clanak/nagradio-ga-pantovcak-umjesto-progona-ravnateljzavoda-koji-nadzire-zamp-promoviran/608936.aspx "Nagradio ga Pantovčak: Umjesto progona, ravnatelj Zavoda koji nadzire ZAMP promoviran!" / "The President rewarded him: Instead of facing prosecution, the Director of the Office responsible for monitoring ZAMP was promoted!"], index.hr, 10 April 2014, (in Croatian)</ref><ref>[http://www.ip-watch.org/2014/10/06/right-of-reply-to-ip-watch-article-epo-internal-strife-spills-over-into-european-parliament-human-rights-court/ Right Of Reply To IP-Watch Article:“EPO Internal Strife Spills Over Into European Parliament, Human Rights Court”], Intellectual Property Watch, 6 October 2014</ref>
It has been reported in the Croatian media that a criminal complaint against Topic was dismissed as inadmissible by the Zagreb County Court on 19 February 2016.<ref>[http://www.tjedno.hr/zupanijski-sud-odbacio-istragu-protiv-zeljka-topica-kao-nedopustenu/ ŽUPANIJSKI SUD ISTRAGU PROTIV ŽELJKA TOPIĆA PROGLASIO NEDOPUŠTENOM], tjedno.hr, 23 February 2016</ref> Details of the case were not published but it was subsequently reported that it is currently{{old|2017|12|29}} pending before a three-judge appeal panel of the Zagreb County Court.<ref>[http://www.dnevno.hr/vijesti/hrvatska/pusickina-lobistica-za-un-u-sredistu-medunarodnog-skandala-908177 Pusićkina lobistica za UN u središtu međunarodnog skandala], dnevno.hr, 27 March 2016</ref>
